title: WebGL2.0 doesn't allow flipping frame with blitFramebuffer()
content:
Hi. So in desktop OpenGL it is totally valid to write the following in order to flip the frame vertically into dst buffer: 

 glBlitFramebuffer(0, h, w, 0, 0, 0, w, h, GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT, GL_NEAREST));

In WebGL if I do this:

gl.blitFramebuffer(0, h,w,0 , 0, 0, w, h, gl.COLOR_BUFFER_BIT, gl.NEAREST);

I am getting WebGL warning: blitFramebuffer: If the source is multisampled, then the source and dest regions must match exactly.

Similar error is reported in Chrome.

When I am looking into the related C++ code I can see this: 

        if (dstX0 != srcX0 ||            dstX1 != srcX1 ||            dstY0 != srcY0 ||            dstY1 != srcY1)        {            webgl->ErrorInvalidOperation("%s: If the source is multisampled, then the"                                         " source and dest regions must match exactly.",                                         funcName);            return;        }

I am not sure why this restriction has been imposed. GLES2/3 support this kind of dimensions setup with no errors. Can someone explain the reason behind this? And if it is a bug/missed functionality, where should it be reported?
creator: ivspcom

title: Process manager - identify which window is hogging memory
content:
The process manager tells me which window/process is hogging memory. But I have multiple windows open on multiple workspaces. How do I switch to that window so that I can see what it is and decide what to do about it?

Until recently, clicking on a window listed in the process manager would bring that window to the current workspace (ubuntu/xfce). That changed recently. Now clicking/double-clicking does nothing and there only seems to be the option to kill the process.

I guess I can kill it and then look at recently closed windows to see what it was. But that is a bodgy.

Can I fix the process manager so that when I click on one of its listed windows, I get taken to that window on the workspace where it resides? (It always was inconvenient when previously, double-clicking on the window in the list, brought that window to the current workspace. You had then to work out where it had come from if you wanted to put it back).

Firefox's window/workspace management is otherwise excellent. It's the best in my opinion. When it starts-up, for example, it puts all the windows back on the workspaces where they were when it was last closed. Very nice.
creator: ackerbilk

title: How can I configure Firefox to load a bookmarklet just after loading any URL under a specific domain?
content:
Imagine a web `example.com` + a bookmarklet that powers `example.com` up

  • Suppose a page `example.com` for which I don't control the source code, but I use on a daily basis (imagine any 3rt party cloud system: Trello, Notion, Clickup, Zoho, whatever...)
  • Suppose a bookmarlet we've done to change colors, make clicks, submit forms, and, in general, improve my daily workflows and productivity when using `example.com`

The usual workflow is

1) I first open `example.com` in the browser clicking bookmark `A`, `B`, `C`, `D`... multiple bookmarks that take me to specific pages of that application (different trello boards, different docs in google docs, different zoho customer profiles, etc.). For example bookmark `A` could lead to `example.com/home.html` and bookmark `B` to `example.com/another-page.html` 2) Execute the bookmarklet clicking bookmark `Z`

Now that the bookmarklet has been tested, we plan to extend this usage to all teammates in the company, but we want them to do not have to click two times, one for the page, one for the javascript injection; but click one single time and let firefox to do the job.

Question

How can I instruct Firefox so that "each time you are opening ANY page under the domain `example.com` (no matter if clicking a bookmark, clicking a link, or typing the URL in) then you, Firefox, have to load this specific bookmarklet after loading the page"?

PD: xposted here: https://superuser.com/questions/1746812/how-can-i-configure-firefox-to-load-a-bookmarklet-just-after-loading-any-url-und
creator: xmontero

title: Firefox Sync Meltdown [Critical]
content:
While booting up my laptop, a series of extremely unfortunate crashes occurred back to back and ended up wiping the entirety of my synced login passwords and saved email addresses for all websites. After jumping through the multiple different hoops of profile management, json file extension editing, attempting to use a file explorer to recover previous versions of the required json file, I am at the end of my rope and worse off than where I started. Everything is missing now; bookmarks, passwords, email addresses, everything but recent history in this very browsing session.

All of my json files with relevant information are filled to the brim with null values, nothing seems recoverable and it's honestly a little soul crushing to deal with this. I read online that the the Firefox Sync data is also stored server side, and after multiple attempts of sighing into my account on different devices, I cannot get that server side data to flow back into my browser. If there is anything that can be sent my way to get me back on track, please, please help me out here in recovering my information. This is horrible. I have nothing now.

title: Problem launching firefox with same profile from the command line and from a java application
content:
We are launching firefox from the command line with a specific profile. We sometimes also need to launch firefox from a java application using that exact same profile. But when we do that, we get the error:

"Firefox is already running, but is not responding. To use Firefox, you must first close the existing Firefox process, restart your device, or use a different profile."

We do not get the error when launching from the java application if firefox was not previously started from the command line.

To say that again another way, - If we launch firefox from the command line two times, each time with the same profile, it works fine. - If we launch firefox from the Java application two times, each time with the same profile, it works fine. - But if we launch firefox from the command line then launch firefox from the java application, firefox won't launch due to the error above.

This is firefox 91.13.0esr 64-bit on Linux (CentOS 7).

Thank you for any help you can give.
creator: cynthia.j.freedman

title: PRECISO DE AJUDA
content:
Pessoal acho que meu navegador esta hackeado desde o mes de maio, meu celular foi invadido no mes de março devido a um jogo de poker online e desde que isso aconteceu nao consegui mais ganahr dinheiro nesse jogo. Jogo poker ha dois anos e faz parte da minha renda, e desde que isso aconteceu eu nao consegui mais pagar nem meu cartao de credito.

Ja fiz diversas analises e encontrei uma firmwaree do site original que eu costumava jogar, e reportei os problemas aos caisnos que sou cliente mas nao deram atencao e a falha esta longe de ser resolvida. Entretanto, verificando o firefox, acredito que ate o site da google que eu entro com minha conta de email pode ser um site falso, pois minha localização nunca aparece no local onde estou, e lembro que isso tambem acontecia com o celular que foi hackeado.

Estou enviando os codigos pra vcs analisarem pois encontrei um script no site do google: data async type lbsc.

Acredito que esse script que e o responsavel por manipular as datas e os meus resultados, e isso esta interferindo ateg nos meus aplicativos bancarios. Nao sei mais o que faço, meu prejuizo esta na meia dos 20 mil reais, e ate as pesquisas que eu faço so aparecem resultados de 2021, nao aparecem os resultaods na ordem normal. Ta bem estranho.

Alem disso, agora mudei do windows para o linux e o problema persiste, pois ate o navegador firefox ta com um bloqeio na atualização e nao consigo atualizar de jeito nenhum. Preciso de ajuda.

a ultima imagem mostra que o navegador esta com um bloqueio que nao consigo atualizar.
